seo.title: Cheap Eats in Positano: Budget Food Guide
seo.description: Where to find affordable meals in Positano: panini, pizza al taglio, takeaway salads, minimarkets, and picnic spots.

linkLabel: Eat Like a Local: Positano's Best Budget Bites
intro: Eat well in Positano without overspending by mixing takeaway classics, deli picnics, and local bakeries.

sections.title: Grab-and-go staples
body: Pick up pizza al taglio, panini, or arancini from bars along Via dei Mulini before noon to beat queues.
Order espresso at the counter (“al banco”) for the €1.20 local rate instead of sitting for table service.

sections.title: Casual sit-down spots
body: Look for trattorias uphill from the beach where coperto is modest and house wine is sold by the carafe.
Share starters, skip dessert, and ask for tap water (“acqua del rubinetto”) to keep the bill tight.

sections.title: Picnics with a view
body: Stock up on cheeses, focaccia, and fruit from mini-markets, then picnic on the hostel terrace or Fornillo’s public section.
Carry reusable cutlery and napkins to avoid single-use waste and extra purchases.

sections.title: Sweet breaks & treats
body: Try lemon granita from street carts for a €3 refresher instead of pricier bar cocktails.
Split a slice of delizia al limone or tiramisù from the bakery for an affordable dessert fix.

tips: Ask for the “menu del giorno” or lunch specials—many spots bundle pasta, water, and coffee for under €18.
Bring a collapsible container for leftovers so you can enjoy them at the hostel later.

faqs.q: Can I refill water for free?
a: Yes—fill bottles at the hostel or public fountains like the one near Chiesa Nuova; always carry at least 750 ml (25 oz).
